messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Fwd: Ginza Choshuya News
messages.msgSnippet: Yes, totally. I guess my point was, I would be happy to pay both. Both combined is under US$150 per annum,  andasPete notes, the quality of the images is
messages.messageBody:
Yes, totally. I guess my point was, I would be happy to pay both. Both
combined is under US$150 per annum, andasPete notes, the quality of the
images is outstanding.

Just my thoughts

Richard



klepet33319 wrote:
>
> Personally I prefer to pay the $120, get the beautiful catalogs which I
> can use for reference, and use the on-line translations to help me
> learn to read the descriptions better. Not living in Japan I find
> having the ability to see this caliber of material worth every cent.
> I'm just happy they offer the service as I doubt that they make enough
> off of the international trade to justify it.
>

messages.subject: Re: Fwd: Ginza Choshuya News
messages.msgSnippet: Personally I prefer to pay the $120, get the beautiful catalogs which I can use for reference, and use the on-line translations to help me learn to read the
messages.messageBody:
Personally I prefer to pay the $120, get the beautiful catalogs which I
can use for reference, and use the on-line translations to help me
learn to read the descriptions better. Not living in Japan I find
having the ability to see this caliber of material worth every cent.
I'm just happy they offer the service as I doubt that they make enough
off of the international trade to justify it.

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Fwd: Ginza Choshuya News
messages.msgSnippet: Tom, I got the message and responded, altho I too was challenged by the idea of paying 5000 yen for  access to a catalog. One wonders if a bulk rate could be
messages.messageBody:
Tom,
I got the message and responded, altho I too was challenged by the idea of
paying 5000 yen for access to a catalog. One wonders if a "bulk rate"
could be worked out. I doubt that the JSSUS would be able to see something
like this as a means of serving their members and helping them to move to
the world stage, but the idea might be worth floating. Alternatively we
could try to beat them down.
Peter






Did anybody else get this message?
I checked it out, 50 bucks is a little stiff for sword porn but I
suggested that they make it deductible from the first purchase...

-t
._,___

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Fwd: Ginza Choshuya News
messages.msgSnippet: Me too, I also think less than $50 per year for an English supplement fo rone of my favorite magazines is more than ok. When I learn to read Japanese I can
messages.messageBody:
Me too, I also think less than $50 per year for an English supplement fo
rone of my favorite magazines is more than ok. When I learn to read
Japanese I can then just simply enjoy the magazine I guess.

Cheers

Richard
